number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 11, 2016
												After a few good hours dedicated to this game, I have grown to love it.Admittedly, the tutorial is quite crap but once you get past it with some help from some more experienced players as well as teaming up with other fellow newbies, I have become absolutely addicted to the game.For my pro's: The game has a unique look. The gameplay mechanics are also very different from any other MMO I've ever played but I like them. I love the rebirth system. I love how I have the option to play as a pet. Customizing your character to make them totally unique from any other player is so easy. There are so many little hidden features and abilities. It's very easy to level up and glide through most quests and dungeons. I think the marriage and family system is adorable. The NPC's seem very fleshed out. The artwork for the game is just awesome. The choice in variety of pets is immense and I love it to pieces. The world seems very open and very immersive. Most enemies are pretty easy. You don't lose all of your items when you die. The aging system is pretty neat. The weight system is nifty as well.For my con's: The combat system is crap as is the tutorial. When you meet a difficult enemy, it literally takes you ages to beat them and you end up using all of your "Ask Nao for Help"'s and Lorna Balloons on one boss battle. Dungeons can become extremely painstakingly repetitive. Getting to the Another World is hell and being able to sustain yourself within the world is even harder. The enemies in Another World are ridiculously OP no matter what level you are. Losing important quest items happens all the time to me and makes it that much more frustrating when trying to further quests. Some quests are beyond impossible to complete, especially when you can't even join a party for other players to come help you out. I've ditched three quests so far because my level 55 gunslinger can't even make it past the first few enemies.8/10. Just because the game is so much more fun with friends, I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who loves MMO's.

Posted: July 13, 2015
												Honestly the best MMO i've ever played despite its age. I put and invested countless hours into this game off steam (which shows in the lack of hours.) The number one reason why this game isn't as famous as it should be is because it's simply owned by Nexon. The company has ruined many popular titles such as MapleStory, Dungeon Fighter Online, and yes that includes Mabinogi. All games are still popular in korea, but due to the INSANE price differences in the Korea version VS. the NA version cash shops, this MMO constantly has you spending 3x-4x more than an average Korean player. If this game was owned by another company such as Riot Games, or another known good company with a good sense of customer relations, this would easily topple the gaming industry in terms of Fantasy MMOs. Highly recommend if you're going to spend thousands of dollars on this "f2p" mmo to try and buy Final Fantasy 14 Online. Yes its subscription, but in the end its a lot cheaper than Nexon's "f2p" mmos.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 11, 2016
												After a few good hours dedicated to this game, I have grown to love it.Admittedly, the tutorial is quite crap but once you get past it with some help from some more experienced players as well as teaming up with other fellow newbies, I have become absolutely addicted to the game.For my pro's: The game has a unique look. The gameplay mechanics are also very different from any other MMO I've ever played but I like them. I love the rebirth system. I love how I have the option to play as a pet. Customizing your character to make them totally unique from any other player is so easy. There are so many little hidden features and abilities. It's very easy to level up and glide through most quests and dungeons. I think the marriage and family system is adorable. The NPC's seem very fleshed out. The artwork for the game is just awesome. The choice in variety of pets is immense and I love it to pieces. The world seems very open and very immersive. Most enemies are pretty easy. You don't lose all of your items when you die. The aging system is pretty neat. The weight system is nifty as well.For my con's: The combat system is crap as is the tutorial. When you meet a difficult enemy, it literally takes you ages to beat them and you end up using all of your "Ask Nao for Help"'s and Lorna Balloons on one boss battle. Dungeons can become extremely painstakingly repetitive. Getting to the Another World is hell and being able to sustain yourself within the world is even harder. The enemies in Another World are ridiculously OP no matter what level you are. Losing important quest items happens all the time to me and makes it that much more frustrating when trying to further quests. Some quests are beyond impossible to complete, especially when you can't even join a party for other players to come help you out. I've ditched three quests so far because my level 55 gunslinger can't even make it past the first few enemies.8/10. Just because the game is so much more fun with friends, I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who loves MMO's.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 21, 2015
												This game is easily one of my favorites. I've not played it as long as some people, but overall I've got around (Edit) 550 hours (Including Steam & Non-Steam Hours). The game has many stories in it, even some from Shakespeare, some of my personal favorites. There's plenty of events to keep you occupied. Even if you get bored of the game, which for me, was after around 150 hours, you'll be wanting to come back to it eventually and I played it even longer after coming back to it. Story : 10/10 - Takes far longer to beat than plenty of games I've ever played and has multiple stories. Graphics : 6.5/10 - The game runs on an older engine, so graphics aren't the best, but the artwork is beautiful.  Combat : 8.5/10 - While it certainly isn't as fun as the combat in TERA (Another amazing mmorpg), the combat is better than that of many mmo's I've played. Community : 7.5/10 - The game is rather old so there's not as many players as there could be on it. Overall, the community's fun, helpful, and rather friendly. As far as being helpful goes, many experienced players are willing to help new players get a grasp on the game's key features, especially combat.  Gameplay : 9/10 - There's enough to keep you busy for a while, so there's not much to hate about it.Overall, this game was great and I plan to keep coming back to it. The game definitely deserves more attention & players than it gets. If I was to go over everything in this game, this review would be several paragraphs longer so try the game out for yourself :PEdit: The only thing I disliked about this game was it being owned by Nexon. I've typically not enjoyed games they own but this one is different and doesn't have a pay-to-win feel like other games I've played.

												A little about this game, for an MMORPG it has a lot of hidden little secrets like gifting to the npcs to get special items to be sold, no factions but still has some pvp. 												I'd say this game has lived quite past its glorious day, but most of its features can be interesting.Firsthand, the crafting system feels a bit more involved, for you actually have to toss-in inputs in order to gain improved results, which is quite an interesting twist on the standard MMORPG's way of rolling with that.The combat system feels a bit awkward at first, but that issue will eventually disappear with time.The main issue I can perceive so far is related to the low server population, but it is quite normal at this advanced stage of existence.Lastly, if you enjoy life skills and some creative class design, this game has plenty of them to entertain you for quite a while.

												If you're looking for a fantasy life game that isn't the sims, play this first. This game is really fun with friends. Get friends, play with them. I've been playing on and off since I was about 10 or 11. I am now 16, still fun but the game has changed more than I would have liked it to. The social aspect is really awesome, the game isn't really suit for pvp unless you're dueling or have your trans pvp activated. One of the only things I don't like about it now is how it seems that it is beginning to die out of players, Alexina still says "new server" even though it came out before I even started playing, Nexon made it incredibly easier for new players to get a hold of the game if they're under level 1k (now new people wont know the struggle of having to wait for weeks just to rebirth). Other than the nostalgia of being a kid that it gives me, I have to say it is indeed one of the best MMO games I've ever played since it hits the dot when it says "fantasy life."

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 23, 2016
												Playing Mabinogi is one thing I'll never regret. The memories I've made playing with friends I made will probably be some of the most long lasting. Honestly the community made the game for me. Playing Mabinogi solo will definetly start to get boring after a while, as most of the solo content is a grind fest other than the Saga. So I would definetly recommend trying to reach out and make friends to play with. Other than the community, the game was alright. The fighting style is unique and different than most MMOs out there. Plus there's a lot of space to move around in as they give you opportunities to "Rebirth" which allows you to change your class or proffession and restart yourself to lvl 1 while keeping all of your previous stats. But I would highly recommend sticking with a combat class to start with in the beginning as it's always nice to have a a certain class that you can lean on. Another thing that I liked about this game is that the devs keep a constant amount of events to do every now and then to help keep you entertained. They also interact with their player base occasionally getting on, or through events where you can spend time with them. And if you ever so wish, you could also stalk them on twitter if that's your thing. But the devs in Mabinogi are probably the most interactive I've ever seen in an MMO. They also have interactive NPCs which I find pretty interesting. All in all my experiance with Mabinogi was mostly postive. Reading some of the reviews from old time players, seeing them leave is honestly a bit sad as it's thanks to them that we newer players are able to experience the best out of this game as some of them spent their time putting a whole bunch of info on a Wiki for us, so if you decide to play I'd definetly recommend you check it out. Mabinogi might not ever be as it once was for them, as their expectations may have been shot down, but for new casual players, I don't think it should be much of a problem.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 29, 2016
												In the past, it was a great game that pushed for community.  As it grew, it became more and more solo focused.  The combat system was designed to be slow paced.  Would definitely recommend this game for those who enjoy developing their characters into a one-man killing machine.  Or those who just love fashion, or looking cute, or love to afk in towns.Recommendations for in-game:- Number 1 thing to do is: Visit the wiki, get an idea of which path you would want to start with.- Start by focusing on your life skills.  They will improve your combat abilities through passive means.- Rank each skill up one by one so that you can achieve Rank 1 in each.- Take advantage of your newbie status by resetting your Rank 1 skills so that you have more AP to rank another skill. (Recommended since you will be free to rank your skill back to 1 without training again)- Talk casually with people, ask and let them lord over you as if you need shelter from an invisible enemy. (There are good people who are understanding and make recommendations for skill paths or training methods, others will try to shove their methods down your throat)The Good (presently):- Game is largely solo-able since a large part of the community seems consist of isolated groups.- Story line is ok if you don't care how they butcher some mythological characters.- Combat is unique, inbetween fast and slow pace.  Used to run on a Rock-Paper-Scissors sort.- Life skills are extremely tedious, but is also the most rewarding.- Large variety of pets.- Huge map filled with life.The Bad (presently):- Community seems to be extremely immature and isolated.  Many are obessessed with PvP.- Skills are in no-way balanced for PvP while patches try improve the PvP scene.- Heavy on the Pay-to-win scale.  Pets are now stacked with beneficial buffs or attacks when summoned. (almost game breaking)- Group are hard to find for dungeons or challenges for new players.  Not many are willing to have a character that isn't stacked in their groups.- Latest Patches have made their gorgeous map into nothing worth exploring (very little reason to head out there and kill mobs)

But If you're a new player who wants to get into PVP right away you'll never be able to compete with players that has been in the server for years. Players that's been in for years are basically gods when it comes to pvp. Just don't bother trying to be the top PVP-er.Been playing for at least 2 weeks and i'll just list the pros and cons.Pros:-Fun-Various of systems ingame that'll keep you busy-Friendly players who are willing to help you and teach you (So far i haven't met a♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥-Complex systems but at the same time once you get the hang of it you'll realize that its awesome.-Admirable and adorable stuff in it. If you like anime and dressing up your character in various ways this game is for you.Con:-Some stuff you have to actually use cash like pets. But you can get them through hard work which takes awhile if you have no time to grind.-This game is a grind fest. To get strong or craft better things you have to grind for it. In layman's term grinding is basically training to get more experience for your character. This game is the so time consuming and addictive once you get into it that it'll consume your soul and you'll be like FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUk . . . there goes another day . . . . .-Exploration experience is a B***H to obtain. Its one of the things I hate in the game cause you have to actually take hours of your time to grind for Exploration experience just to level your exploration level so that you can get your AP.All in all its a fun game. Just remember your the player. You're in control of the game not the other way around. Don't be played by the game fam . . .

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 21, 2015
												This game is easily one of my favorites. I've not played it as long as some people, but overall I've got around (Edit) 550 hours (Including Steam & Non-Steam Hours). The game has many stories in it, even some from Shakespeare, some of my personal favorites. There's plenty of events to keep you occupied. Even if you get bored of the game, which for me, was after around 150 hours, you'll be wanting to come back to it eventually and I played it even longer after coming back to it. Story : 10/10 - Takes far longer to beat than plenty of games I've ever played and has multiple stories. Graphics : 6.5/10 - The game runs on an older engine, so graphics aren't the best, but the artwork is beautiful.  Combat : 8.5/10 - While it certainly isn't as fun as the combat in TERA (Another amazing mmorpg), the combat is better than that of many mmo's I've played. Community : 7.5/10 - The game is rather old so there's not as many players as there could be on it. Overall, the community's fun, helpful, and rather friendly. As far as being helpful goes, many experienced players are willing to help new players get a grasp on the game's key features, especially combat.  Gameplay : 9/10 - There's enough to keep you busy for a while, so there's not much to hate about it.Overall, this game was great and I plan to keep coming back to it. The game definitely deserves more attention & players than it gets. If I was to go over everything in this game, this review would be several paragraphs longer so try the game out for yourself :PEdit: The only thing I disliked about this game was it being owned by Nexon. I've typically not enjoyed games they own but this one is different and doesn't have a pay-to-win feel like other games I've played.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
												I just wanted to note before I go on that the hours on above are innacurate. I have actually played this game much, much more than four hours, I just linked the wrong account to my Steam, so I play it through the Nexon launcher.Mabinogi is a very fun game, but it's very hit and miss depending on the person. You either enjoy it or hate it, and it just depends on who you are. Because it's free to play, I would reccomend at least trying it out for a little bit and see if you get a feel for it. No risk involved!It doooes have some pay to win elements to it, but not so drastically that it's absolutely required. In the beggining of the game, it's not so bad. It's actually better now then it used to be, as they have made the game a lot easier, and give you a free mount to begin with. As you go on, there starts to become a little pressure to buy some things. It doesn't make quests easier or anything, you're not ridiculously weak without it, it simply makes the game more enjoyable. It makes for more character customization, the pets are amazing (probably the best investment in the game, I would say), and the gachapons are usually fun to play and very addicting. I have spent QUITE a bit of money on the game myself, and so have many many of the players, not so much because you have to, more because they manage to make it so appealing.As weird as it is to say, I actually don't think the battle mechanics or general game play are the best part of the game. Battle can be fun, but it can also get tedious and annoying. It gets pretty repetative, but as you get farther there are more and more fun skills. However, battle doesn't even have to be all that prevalent. There are a lot of different classes to play, some for different kinds of combat, others for different life styles entirely. Don't feel like fighting? Be a chef, be a cleric, be a bard! Most of them are very interesting and fun to try out, but most people tend to find their niche and stick with it.The world is huge, and there's a lot of different places to see and things to do. Despite the sort of lack luster graphics, some of the scenery can be very beautiful! There's a lot of different activities, mobs, and dungeons around and most of them are very fun!The game is okay to play solo at first, but the further you get into it, the more it becomes a multiplayer kinda game. I've actually kind of fallen out of the game a bit because I don't have a lot of friends to play the game with. My advice is to just be social. The game is WAY MORE FUN with friends!There's a lot of short quest lines in the game with little mini stories to them, and also a lot of lone quests to play. But I would say the best quests are the story line quests. Not because they have better objectives and things to do, as far as I've noticed it's a lot of playing messanger. But! I think the stories are very fun to follow. They're pretty interesting, and it's fun to learn the lore! As far as the npcs go, it's a large spectrum between awesome and annoying as hell. Most characters aren't so bad, but everybody has some they hate.All in all I would reccomend giving it a shot. If you don't like it, it's just a little time spent, not really any other risks. If you do end up liking it, though, there's a lot of game to have fun with, and you can make some pretty good friends!

content:
Posted: March 26, 2015
												Mabinogi is a complex fantasy world with a vast array of customization, from combat skills to life skills, and highly varied levels of equipments, abilities, and upgrades. My only criticism is that it is easy to lose to the "freedom" that the game gives you, and not be able to focus on a goal because of the willingness to explore so many different areas. There are a bunch of tutorials and beginner boosts to get you going and the many seasonal events keep the game fresh. Gachapon style awards in the cash shop are a pain, but every once in a while... you may get something nice. maybe. The story is very deep, so pay attention! Its definitely well thought out and well worth your time.
